sector.narrative: Research, monitoring and evaluation and knowledge management for C4D
Strengthening C4D in Government systems including preparedness for humanitarian action
Technical assistance - Cross-sectoral communication for development

title.narrative: UNICEF Programmes in Afghanistan (Adolescent Health and Development)
Afghanistan Country Programme Document 2015-2019 Results Matrix
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

description.narrative: Social and Behavioural Change Communication (SBCC) approach launched. 8.6 million Afghans have been reached through mass and social media with COVID-19 messaging. Key guideline documents to integrate C4D in programmes have been delivered. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:30/07/2020

title.narrative: Number of RCCE messages produced and disseminated with UNICEF support, adapted for target groups, in the reporting year [COVID] i) Total number of RCCE messages
Number of RCCE messages produced and disseminated with UNICEF support, adapted for target groups, in the reporting year [COVID]

C4D strategy for Country Programme meets benchmarks to effectively guide actions of programme implementation and/or upstream programmme/policy advocacy in both sectoral and cross-cutting results in priority areas for normative, social and behaviour change and community engagement

baseline.value: 1 - No written C4D strategy in place

target.value: 2021:3: 2-3 of the benchmarks for C4D strategy have been incorporated in the strategy and outlines strategies for establishing or strengthening of participatory processes for community and children and adolescent engagement, with special focus on most marginalized groups

actual.value: 2020:The C4D strategy has been drafted in July and two benchmarks for C4D strategy have been incorporated.

title.narrative: Capacity development strategy under implementation to strengthen and institutionalize C4D skills of government, implementing partners staff at national level and subnational level meets quality standards

baseline.value: Level 1 - C4D capacity development is characterized by at least 1 of the listed benchmarks: Planning

target.value: 2021:Level 3 - C4D humanitarian mechanism is characterized by at least 3 of the listed benchmarks Planning, institutionalization and standardization

actual.value: 2020:Some of key ministries already adopted SBCC systematization under their promotion units

title.narrative: Communication and community engagement coordination mechanism meets standards for accountability to affected populations during Humanitarian crisis

baseline.value: Level 1 - No functional C4D mechanism for populations affected by Humanitarian Crisis

target.value: 2021:Level 2 - C4D humanitarian mechanism is characterized by at least 2 of the listed benchmarks - Responsive

title.narrative: Communication and community engagement platforms/ mechanisms supported by UNICEF meet quality standards across development priorities

baseline.value: Level 2- Quality of C4D Platforms are characterized by at least 1 of the listed benchmarks

target.value: 2021:Level 3 - Quality of C4D Platforms are characterized by at least 2 of the listed benchmarks

actual.value: 2020:Community engagement has reached the benchmark of range
